e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it promotes transparency and reflects the true financial performance of the company. While some investors may initially misinterpret the reported earnings, the long-term benefits of honest reporting and building investor trust outweigh the risks. Ethical business practices can lead to increased investor confidence and a more sustainable growth trajectory.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and consistency in financial disclosures. It should clearly reflect the company's true financial position without intentional bias or manipulation. Additionally, it should consider the diverse investor base, ensuring all stakeholders have access to the information needed to make informed decisions. Ethical policies should also comply with regulations and guidelines set by governing bodies to foster accountability and trust.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the change in policy to investors and what strategies they will employ to ensure that all stakeholders understand the rationale behind the shift to unbiased reporting. Additionally, I would inquire about any potential impacts on stock performance during the transition period and how they plan to address investor concerns.
